page.title: 16Flood Prevention in Combwich
page.content: {Combwich}was regularly cut off from the outside world by tides but in 1981 and again in 1983 houses,shops and the {Anchor Inn}were flooded.In 1981 the tide reached{7.9m.}above{sea level}and damage was estimated to have cost{ {Â£275000.}In 1983 the tide reached{7.6m above{sea level,}causing about{Â£71000} worth of damage.Work was started by Wessex Water in the summer of 1985 to reduce the risk of flood damage.The proposed scheme comprised the construction of a floodbank at a height of 8.4m.running around the village.A new sluice was to be provided in the Pill next to the Harbour Garage incorporating emergency penstocks to guard against tidal flap failure.THe expected cost of the works was{Â£561000.}
